headline.main: At $24.6 Billion, State’s Stimulus Aid Exceeds Expectations
headline.print_headline: At $24.6 Billion, State’s Stimulus Aid Exceeds Expectations

docs.lead_paragraph: New York State stands to get about $24.6 billion for Medicaid, education and other priorities as part of the federal stimulus package, an increase of more than $3 billion from an earlier estimate.

headline.main: Pope Francis Rebukes Myanmar Over Treatment of Rohingya

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The pope spoke after a United Nations report found that crimes against humanity had possibly been committed against the group, a Muslim minority.

headline.main: Obama Fights Back: Former President's Orbit Resists Trump
headline.print_headline: Obama Fights Back: Former President's Orbit Resists Trump

docs.lead_paragraph: Dismayed by the Trump administration's first days, former President Barack Obama's loyalists, former aides and even his spokesman are speaking out and even actively resisting the new American leader. It's a warning to President Donald Trump that his actions won't go unchallenged by those who occupied the White House before him.

headline.main: Breaking Silence, Obama Speaks Out on Trump Immigrants Order
headline.print_headline: Breaking Silence, Obama Speaks Out on Trump Immigrants Order

docs.lead_paragraph: Former President Barack Obama praised protesters who amassed across the country in opposition to President Donald Trump's immigration orders, breaking his silence on political issues for the first time since leaving office.

headline.main: Obama Addresses the Nation One Last Time

headline.main: Republicans Take First Steps to Kill Obama-Era Regulations
headline.print_headline: Republicans Take First Steps to Kill Obama-Era Regulations

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans on Monday continued their drive to loosen U.S. regulation, taking the first step to kill five Obama-era rules on corruption, the environment, labor and guns under the virtually untested Congressional Review Act.

headline.main: Netanyahu Attacks Obama over U.N. Resolution

byline.original: By REUTERS and THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

docs.lead_paragraph: Over the weekend, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu sharply criticized President Obama's administration, after the United Nations Security Council voted to adopt a resolution demanding an end to Israeli settlements on Friday, which the United States did not veto.

headline.main: GOP Moves to Undo Obama Coal Rules Protecting Streams
headline.print_headline: GOP Moves to Undo Obama Coal Rules Protecting Streams

headline.main: Obama Warns Against Support for Israeli Settlements
headline.print_headline: Obama Warns Against Support for Israeli Settlements
